question: Is the same key used for both authentication and encryption in WEP?
options: Yes, if 802.1X authentication is not used
The same key is never used twice
No
Yes

question: What is the major weakness in WEP, exploited by the PTW attack used in the lab?
options: Too short IV
No protection against message replay
The integrity check value
The IV is part of key stream

question: What is EAP?
options: Extensible Authentication Protocol is a set of encapsulation messages for mutual authentication methods
Extensible Authentication Protocol is a set of encapsulation messages for smartcard-based authentication methods
Extensible Authentication Protocol is a set of encapsulation messages for upper-layer authentication methods
Extensible Authentication Protocol is a set of authentication server methods

question: How are EAP messages transported between the authenticator and the authentication server in RSN?
options: EAP messages are encapsulated in TCP/IP
EAP messages are encapsulated in EAP-TLS
EAP messages are encapsulated in VPN
EAP messages are encapsulated in 802.1x

question: Which security method is used in the first phase of PEAP
options: TLS
EAPOL
LEAP

question:
The Pairwise Transient Key (PTK) is a collection of several keys. List these keys and their
length when CCMP is used.
options: EAPOL MIC Key (128), EAPOL Encr Key (128), Data Encr Key (128), Data MIC Key (128)
EAPOL MIC Key (128), EAPOL Encr Key (128), Data Encr/MIC Key (128)
EAPOL MIC Key (128), EAPOL Encr Key (256), Data Encr Key (128), Data MIC Key (128)
EAPOL MIC Key (128), EAPOL Encr Key (128), Data Encr/MIC Key (256)

question: What is Michael in WPA/RSN?
options: The encryption algorithm in TKIP
The key mixing algorithm of RC4
The message integrity code of TKIP
The replay protection algorithm of TKIP

question: What is the purpose of the EAPOL 4-way handshake?
options: To compute a fresh pairwise temporal key (PTK) from the pairwise master key (PMK)
To compute a fresh pairwise master key (PMK) from the pairwise transient key (PTK)
To compute a fresh pairwise transient key (PTK) from the pairwise master key (PMK) after both parties have verified the PMK
To compute a fresh pairwise message key (PMK) from the pairwise trusted key (PTK) generated in the 4-way key agreement

question: How does the counter mode operation of a block cipher E() work?
options: <math><mi>C</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>E</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>i</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>⊕</mo><mi>i</mi></math>
<math><mi>C</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>E</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>i</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>⊕</mo><mi>M</mi><mo>⊕</mo><mi>i</mi></math>
<math><msub><mi>C</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>E</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>i</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>⊕</mo><msub><mi>M</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math>
<math><mi>C</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>E</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>i</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>⊕</mo><mi>M</mi></math>

question: How is the IEEE 802.11 CCMP nonce input constructed?
options: The values of the Pairwise Transient Key, the NonceA, and the NonceB
The values of the Pairwise Temporal Key, the Source Address, and the Destination Address
The values of the fields Packet Number, Address1, Flag of the MPDU
The values of the fields Packet Number, Address2, Priority of the MPDU

question: Does GSM provide mutual authentication?
options: No
Yes
Operator dependent
In cooperation with UMTS

question: How is the subscriber identity protected from radio channel eavesdropping in GSM?
options: By the network providing temporary subscriber identities to the SIMs
By storing the subscriber identity in the SIM only
By storing the 128-bit secret key (<math><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>IMSI</mi></msub></math>) in the SIM and distributed only to trusted VLRs
By using the IMEI instead of the IMSI

question: Which information is sent from the AuC to the VLR/SGSN during 3G/UMTS authentication?
options: IMSI
RAND, AUTN, XRES, CK, IK
RAND, AUTN
RAND, AUTN, XRES, Kc

question: Which UTRAN layers provide encryption?
options: MAC layer and RRC layer
RLC layer and RRC layer
PHY layer and MAC layer
MAC layer and RLC layer

question: What happens if the result of the UTRAN algorithm negotiation is that the user equipment (UE) and the network do not have a common encryption algorithm?
options: UTRAN provides a new encryption algorithm as an app
The connection is shut down immediately by UTRAN
UTRAN may establish the connection without encryption
UTRAN does not use encryption algorithm negotiation

question: Can the security header in MAPsec be encrypted? Why/why not?
options: No, because the header consists of {SPI || Original Component ID || TVP}
Yes, because the header consists of {SPI || Original Component ID || TVP}
No, because the MAPsec header must be processed at the receiving end
Yes, because an IPsec tunnel is set up

question: Which CSCF handles SIP registration requests and informs the Home Subscription Server (HSS)?
options: All
P-CSCF
I-CSCF
S-CSCF

question: Which three modes does the confidentiality algorithm in UMTS support?
options: RLC-Transparent, RLC-Unacknowledged, RLC-Acknowledged
RRC-Transparent, RRC-Unacknowledged, RRC-Acknowledged
RLC-Transparent, RRC-Unacknowledged, RLC-Acknowledged
RRC-Transparent, RLC-Unacknowledged, RRC-Acknowledged

question: In which mode of operation is KASUMI used for constructing the 3GPP f8 key stream generator?
options: Combining Counter-mode and ECB-mode
Combining Counter-mode and CCM-mode
Combining Counter-mode and OFB-mode
Combining Counter-mode and CBC-mode

question: What are the three functional requirements for UMTS authentication?
options: Mutual authentication between USIM and HSS, securing the radio channel communication, and end-to-end confidentiality
Mutual authentication between USIM and AuC, securing the radio channel communication, and user identity confidentiality
Confidentiality and privacy for the subscriber, and mutual authentication for the service provider
AV generation at AuC, key transport to the RNC, and the SQN synchronization

question: What was the underlying assumption for the MILENAGE security analysis?
options: No assumptions were made
The kernel function must be a robust block cipher
AES must be used as the kernel function
The kernel function must be a oneway function

question: Which part of the IEEE 802.16 MAC PDU is encrypted?
options: Both the header and the payload part
The payload part and some fields of the header
The payload part
The header part

question: Which WiMAX entity is generating the Traffic Encryption Key (TEK)?
options: The Base Station
The AAA Server
The Access Service Network
The Network Service Provider

question: Why can the USIM be removed from the rest of the UE?
options: The USIM holds an expiration date and, like credit cards, must be replaced
The failure rate of the integrated circuit cards (UICCs) are high because the issuers (mobile operators) want to optimize cost against subscription duration
The UE manufacturing and lifecycle can be managed independently from the personalization and subscription process
End-to-end UMTS key-card plugs into the USIM slot for key distribution and management

question: What is Internet Key Exchange (IKE)?
options: The security association set up protocol in the IPsec protocol suite
The key exchange subprotocol of the Transport Layer Security protocol
The key transformation protocol for the inter-operation of GSM and UMTS
The security association center in the IMS system
